sentences.english: Marianne was going to retort, but she remembered her promises and forbore.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽安正想反驳，但她记起了自己的诺言，便。

sentences.english: Her lips were sealed by a promise.
Sometimes people don't understand the promises that they're making when they make them.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，人们许诺时并没有真懂自己许的诺言。

sentences.english: She is always hardworking and she always keeps her promise.
sentences.chinese: 她总用功，她总是保持她的诺言。

sentences.english: It seems out of harmony, someway, with the beauty and promise of the day.
sentences.chinese: 似乎出和谐，好歹，与美丽的诺言一天。

sentences.english: I released him from his promise.
A promise, the preservation period and a few years.
sentences.chinese: 酝酿着的诺言，保存期又有几年。

sentences.english: If there is one thing that annoys me, it’s people who don’t keep their promises.
sentences.chinese: 如果有什么使我恼火的话，那就是不遵守诺言的人。

sentences.english: We shall have to pin him down to his promise.
sentences.chinese: 我们将只好迫使他履行诺言。

sentences.english: Gail kept her word and returned all the money.
sentences.chinese: 盖尔履行了她的诺言，把钱如数归还。

sentences.english: Then, cacique abides by a promise, put them.
sentences.chinese: 于是，酋长遵守诺言，放了他们。

sentences.english: It's a crime that some people don't carry out their promises.
sentences.chinese: 那些不履行诺言的人是可耻的。

sentences.english: Jack kept his word and attended Mr. Belser's funeral.
sentences.chinese: 杰克履行了他的诺言，参加了贝尔瑟先生的葬礼。

sentences.english: In fact, they may not deliver at all.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，他们或许根本不会履行诺言。

sentences.english: Keep your promise, his first heart is the wind.
sentences.chinese: 信守自己的诺言，是风臣人最初的本心。

sentences.english: One must honor his contract and keep his word.
sentences.chinese: 任何人都应当尊重合同，信守诺言。

definition: Ying Zheng (260-210 BC), personal name of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]
to keep an appointment/to keep one's word

Diaochan (-192), one of the four legendary beauties 四大美女[si4 da4 mei3 nu:3], in fiction a famous beauty at the break-up of Han dynasty, given as concubine to usurping warlord Dong Zhuo 董卓[Dong3 Zhuo2] to ensure his overthrow by fighting hero Lü Bu 呂布|吕布[Lu:3 Bu4]
to promise/to undertake to do something/commitment
Han Xin (-196 BC), famous general of first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1]
person/number of people/(per) capita/(a person's) head/(Tw) person whose identity is used by sb else (e.g. to create a bogus account)
to pretend to be (asleep etc)/to disguise oneself as/pretense/disguise/(military) to camouflage/camouflage
to start on a journey/to be on one's way
